Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

core

### Description

There are a few cases where a similar misconfiguration can happen, for example:

- `@defer (on immediate; on viewport; prefetch on idle)` -- with `on immediate` other conditions do not make sense, since they'll never be triggered.
- `@defer (on timer(5s); prefetch on timer(10s))` -- the timer in the prefetch part would never be invoked to.

There might be more cases like this. It'd be great to have an extended diagnostics that would detect this and output a warning.

Issues.Title: Move Webpack to an optional dependency
Issues.Body:
### Command

build

### Description

With `application` builder serving as the default for new applications in v17+ and leveraging esbuild + Vite, new apps no longer need Webpack to build. However, Webpack is still a _required_ dependency, even though it isn't used. This significantly bloats `node_modules` and decreases supply chain security as we have to pull in a number of community plugins.

### Describe the solution you'd like

These apps shouldn't have to depend on Webpack at all when they're not using it. Instead, Webpack should become an optional peer dependency of `@angular-devkit/build-angular` (similar to Karma, Jest, Jasmine, Protractor, etc.). We'll also need a migration to explicitly add Webpack as a dependency for those still on `browser` builder.

With this, `node_modules` will hopefully become significantly lighter and install times should be heavily reduced.

Two options in particular which stand out:

Issues.Title: bug(ALL): CSS variable fallback values not present in v17
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

16.x

### Description

In our applications, we have built CSS for the MDC components without applying an MDC theme. We include mat.core(), and we build on that. It seems that in v17, the base non-themed CSS for many (all?) components, as defined in the published .mjs files, no longer include fallback values for when the --mdc* variables are not defined. Take slider for example. Here is a rule published in 16.x as part of slider.mjs:

```
.mat-mdc-slider .mdc-slider__thumb-knob{border-radius:var(--mdc-slider-handle-shape, 50%); ...
```

In v17, there is no fallback value in slider.mjs:

```
.mat-mdc-slider .mdc-slider__thumb-knob{border-radius:var(--mdc-slider-handle-shape); ...
```

I am guessing this change was intentional, but not having those fallback values is breaking the styling of our applications. For example, given the lack of the above fallback, the slider thumb knob is no longer rounded How can we get the default values present in 16.x to be present in 17? Is there some way to set the variables to their defaults?

### Reproduction

StackBlitz link: https://stackblitz.com/edit/components-issue-cawym5
Steps to reproduce:
1. Include only mat.core() in the application's CSS
2. See slider thumb is square


### Expected Behavior

CSS variable fallback values to be present, slider thumbs to be rounded

### Actual Behavior

CSS variable fallback values are not present, slider thumbs are square

### Environment

- Angular: 17.0.1
- CDK/Material: 17.0.0
- Browser(s): Chrome 119
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows

Issues.Title: bug(mdc-icon-button): adding border to mat-icon-button causes icon to become misaligned
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

When using the basic implementation of mat-icon-button the icon inside the button is properly aligned as expected within the button. It is centered both vertically and horizontally.

When a border is added to the mat-icon-button it shifts the icon down and to the right by the size of the border.

For instance a CSS border like so:
  border: 1px solid black
would cause the icon to move down by 1px and right 1px, this causes the icon to now be misaligned.

This is almost unnoticeable on small borders, but is increasingly obvious as the border gets bigger.

### Reproduction

StackBlitz link: https://stackblitz.com/edit/components-issue-8mcihf?file=src%2Fapp%2Fexample-component.html

You should be able to see once loaded that the icons are not centered within their border/parent element(button).


### Expected Behavior

Expect the icon within a mat-icon-button to be centered with or without border, and no matter what size the border is.

### Actual Behavior

The border width affects the position of the icon within the mat-icon-button causing it to not be centered.

Issues.Title: bug(Mat-Autocomplete): Selected Option does not get appropriate CSS when using OptGroup and Filtered List
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

In the normal AutoComplete when selecting an option, it will get highlighted via the "mdc-list-item--selected" class being added to the mat-option and also the mat-pseudo-checkbox element getting inserted.  However, when you configure an AutoComplete with OptGroup and use filtering, this does not occur.  

This is reproducible in the Angular Material example for the Options Groups Autocomplete.

### Reproduction

StackBlitz link: https://stackblitz.com/edit/youm9c?file=src%2Fexample%2Fautocomplete-optgroup-example.html
Steps to reproduce:
1. Select an option in the Filtered group
2. Open the dropdown after selecting and note that it is not highlighted and does not include the checkbox


### Expected Behavior

Selected option gets Highlighted via the "mdc-list-item--selected" class being added to mat-option and inserts html for mat-pseudo-checkbox

https://i.stack.imgur.com/II4v3.png

### Actual Behavior

Selected option does not get the css or html added to provide any visual indication that this option has been selected.

https://i.stack.imgur.com/UFq2N.png

### Environment

- Angular: 17
- CDK/Material: 16.2.11
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows 11
